DOC.brief_title: A Study Assessing Safety Utility PINPOINT® Near Infrared Fluorescence Imaging Identification Lymph Nodes Patients With Uterine Cervical Malignancies Who Are Undergoing Lymph Node Mapping
DOC.criteria: 18 year age old Subjects FIGO Clinical Stage I endometrial cancer undergo minimally invasive hysterectomy lymph node mapping . Subjects FIGO Clinical Stage IA cervical cancer ≤ 2 cm size undergo minimally invasive hysterectomy , trachelectomy , conization lymph node mapping . Subjects clinical Stage IA1 cervical cancer without lympho vascular space involvement ( LVSI ) negative margin cone biopsy include . Subjects negative nodal status ( N0 ) Subjects negative metastatic involvement ( M0 ) . Have prior dissection and/or radiation pelvis . Advanced cervical endometrial cancer , T3/T4 lesions Diagnosis cervical cancer tumor size great 2 cm . Locally advanced inflammatory cervical uterine cancer Metastatic cervical uterine cancer . Known allergy history adverse reaction ICG , iodine iodine dye . Known allergy history adverse reaction Blue dye ( Isosulfan blue ) triphenylmethane . Hepatic dysfunction define MELD Score > 12 . Renal dysfunction define serum creatinine ≥ 2.0 mg/dl . Subjects participate another investigational study within 30 day prior surgery . Pregnant lactating subject . Subjects , Investigator 's opinion , medical condition make subject poor candidate investigational procedure , interfere interpretation study result .
